Acquisition of the necessary equipment and software for the implementation of a 5G/6G testing environment within the framework of the Lusitania-5G/6G port project Funded under the Recovery, Transformation and Resilience Plan - European Union NextGenerationEU, within the framework of the UNICO R&D 6G 2023 Program Contract for the acquisition, installation and configuration of equipment that allows the establishment of a test environment for a basic 5G network architecture; in order to validate the research previously carried out through simulation techniques and make it possible to carry out new research in each of the components of the architecture or as a whole. Due to the diverse nature of the equipment to be acquired, this document is divided into two different lots, on the one hand, the expansion of the virtualization platform and on the other, the acquisition of a scalable platform for the emulation and testing of 5G mobile networks. Expansion of the COMPUTAEX virtualization platform The extension offered must include at least the following elements: Three (3) servers for the virtualization platform in accordance with the characteristics of clause 2.1.1 of this PPT, as well as their maintenance service for a period of 3 years. The purpose of this contract is the comprehensive management and intelligent exterior public lighting, renovation and maintenance of interior lighting and electrical and thermal installations of municipal buildings and offices and ornamental fountains in the city of Huelva, and serve as an operational tool for the pursuit of the objectives of energy efficiency, operational improvement, digitalization and innovation marked by municipal strategies (Urban Agenda, Municipal Plan against Climate Change and Innovation Master Plan, through the objective of carbon neutrality). The ultimate goal of the contract is to structure the actions to implement the development of energy strategies framed in the Innovation Master Plan of the Huelva City Council 2024-2027. Based on this plan, the Huelva City Council is committed to innovation as an essential factor to accelerate its urban development under the triple logic of economic, social and environmental sustainability. Furthermore, it aims to adopt an exemplary leadership role in the field of innovation, seeking a notable evolution in the way of providing public services. Summary: Language Training Service for the Catalan Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology (Icn2). Description: Description of the service: The object of this contract is the provision of language training services - Catalan, Spanish and English - intended for the staff of the ICN2. Through this contract, it is intended to offer professionals who work in the Institute the opportunity to acquire, perfect or consolidate their knowledge and communication skills in one of these languages, thus contributing to the improvement of their language skills and professional development within the organization. Due to the fact that the ICN2 does not have either the personal means or the technical means necessary and sufficient to carry out these functions, the contracting of these services through the present contracting procedure is essential. The services will be carried out in accordance with this specification, the technical specifications specification and the contract resulting from this procedure.. Published Date: 2025-12-12. The object of this file is the contracting of services associated with the organization and management of training and linguistic immersion stays abroad for teachers participating in bilingual projects in public centers in Andalusia. These Services take the form of organizing and carrying out two-week stays (during the months of July and August 2026) for a maximum of 240 participants (210 in Ireland and the United Kingdom and 20 in France and 10 from Portugal), including the organization of stays, assistance service to participants, travel and transportation, accommodation and maintenance, completion of a training course and contracting an insurance policy. Summary: Teaching Service for the Development of Courses and Language Learning Activities Aimed at Users of the Network of Civic Centers of Tarragona. Description: Description of the service: This is the provision of introductory language courses and language activities that together add up to a maximum duration of 300 hours in total of language training aimed at users of the Network of Centers Citizens who want to come into contact with languages ​​and their conversation in a dynamic way and from the perspective of educational leisure. It consists of designing and implementing a varied training offer that includes languages ​​with high social demand and utility practice (English, French, German, Catalan, etc.); create dynamic and participatory methodologies that encourage the oral and written practice of languages ​​in real and everyday contexts; promote the participation of people of various age groups, origin and social conditions, ensuring the inclusion of groups with difficulties accessing language learning; and periodically assess participant progress and course quality using indicators such as attendance, satisfaction and achievement of individual goals.. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: I2CAT PRIVATE FOUNDATION, INTERNET AND DIGITAL INNOVATION IN CATALONIA. Summary: Training and Mentoring Services of the "Incuba Talent Digital" Program Within the Framework of the "Impulse of the Nuclear Transition Funds" Program. Description: Description of the service: The contractual object consists of specialized training and mentoring services within the framework of the "Incuba Talent Digital" project. The "Incuba Talent Digital" project is an incubator that aims to provide technological and business training for entrepreneurial initiatives of the areas affected by the environmental impact of the production of nuclear electricity to facilitate the economic diversification, inclusion and digital transformation of the territory, in compliance with the order that the Secretariat of Digital Policies (affiliated to the Department of Business and Labor of the Generalitat de Catalunya) has done to the i2CAT Foundation. This assignment responds to the mandate of Article 8.4.c) of Law 5/2020, of April 29, on fiscal, financial and administrative measures and the public sector and the creation of the tax on facilities that affect the environment, which establishes that 50% of the income related to the activities of production, storage and transformation of electrical energy of nuclear origin must be used to nurture a fund to finance, among others, socio-economic development actions aimed at the areas affected by the impact environmental impact of the production of nuclear electricity and that among the priority lines of action and object of financing by the fund are, among others, the new technologies. Published Date: 2025-12-03. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: I2CAT PRIVATE FOUNDATION, INTERNET AND DIGITAL INNOVATION IN CATALONIA

Description: The development of a plan to promote school success, prevent absenteeism and improve coexistence in the educational centers of the Usera district 2026-2028.<br> The fundamental principle of this Plan is to make the universal right to education a reality, with a gender perspective1, inclusive, democratic and equitable, focused on the promotion of all students in the district, enhancing their learning abilities and the development of emotional intelligence.<br> It is a project agreed with the comprehensive neighborhood plans (PIBA), a way to continue collaborating with the centers educational in the response to the problems that prevent all students in the district, regardless of the social reality in which they find themselves, from successfully completing at least the compulsory schooling stage, providing them with tools aimed at reducing the variables of risk that can lead to a situation of school failure and maladjustment and their abandonment or exclusion from the educational system and reinforce the protective factors that avoid these situations. It is about incorporating positive educational experiences that directly affect the causes that They cause a student to lead to a situation of school failure and truancy and psychosocial imbalances that prevent good coexistence in educational centers.<br> Plan to promote school success, prevent absenteeism and improve coexistence in the educational centers of the distri.... input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING. Summary: Co-Education Course and Gender Perspective in the Pfi Classroom (Training and Insertion Programs). Description: Description of the service: The "Co-education and gender perspective in the PFI classroom" course will last 30 hours. The methodology will combine an asynchronous part, through the Odissea XTEC platform (Moodle), with a block of synchronous sessions—live online connections—that will last term on Thursday afternoons. The contents of the course are: 1. Theoretical framework of the binary sex gender system.2. Theoretical framework of co-education: protocols, experiences and areas of co-education.3. Tools for the prevention, detection, intervention of sexist and LGBTI-phobic violence. 4. perspective intersectional, how can we keep it in mind?5. Construction of masculinity and femininity in an anti-feminist context. 6. Proposals and specific tools to apply to educational centers.7. Positioning regarding the issue: how I commit myself as a professional to the him?. Published Date: 2025-11-26. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL TRAINING
output.Summary: Co-Education Course and Gender Perspective in the Pfi Classroom (Training and Insertion Programs)
output.Description: Description of the service: The "Co-education and gender perspective in the PFI classroom" course will last 30 hours. The methodology will combine an asynchronous part, through the Odissea XTEC platform (Moodle), with a block of synchronous sessions—live online connections—that will last term on Thursday afternoons. The contents of the course are: 1. Theoretical framework of the binary sex gender system.2. Theoretical framework of co-education: protocols, experiences and areas of co-education.3. Tools for the prevention, detection, intervention of sexist and LGBTI-phobic violence. 4. perspective intersectional, how can we keep it in mind?5. Construction of masculinity and femininity in an anti-feminist context. 6. Proposals and specific tools to apply to educational centers.7. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: MONTCADA AND REIXAC COUNCIL. Summary: Cooking Training for Students of Curricular Diversification. Description: Description of the service: In the framework of the DiLTET (Local Device for School-Work Transition), the Education Service of the Montcada i Reixac City Council, through the agreement signed with the Department of Education of the Generalitat, collaborates by offering secondary education centers the possibility of doing practical training for 3rd year ESO students that is part of the unique project of the centers (curriculum diversification programs). This is a professional taste with the following objectives:- Motivate students in order to keep them in the education system and prevent possible situations of absenteeism.- Increase expectations of educational success, increasing confidence in themselves and in their possibilities.- Favor learning the skills and knowledge of the curriculum of the stage through practical and manipulative activities.- Discover new skills and interests in students.- Acquire basic skills in the professional field.- Guide students to through practical training on trades, in this case, on the profession of cook (this training is a proposal of the three tastings that are carried out during the school year).. Published Date: 2025-11-15. Closing Date: 2025-11-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: MAYOR'S OFFICE OF THE HUMANES CITY COUNCIL OF MADRID. Summary: Management of the Platero Y Yo Nursery School Owned by the Humanes De Madrid City Council. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: CONSORCI DE SALUT I D-ATENCIÓ SOCIAL DE CATALUNYA. Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement of an Innovative Systemic Sustainability Transition Solution for Health Care Organisations (Suhco). Description: Procurement will take the form of pre-commercial procurement (PCP), where R&D service contracts will be awarded in parallel to different R&D providers in a phased approach. This will allow alternative, competing solutions to be compared. Each selected operator will receive a framework contract covering three R&D phases. The three phases are: Solution design, prototype development, original development and validation and testing of a limited volume of the first products or services. After each phase, interim evaluations are conducted to select the best of the competing solutions. The contractors with the best value for money will be offered a specific contract for the next phase. The selected operators will retain ownership of the intellectual property rights (IPRs) they generate during the PCP and will be able to use them to exploit the full market potential of the solutions developed. All interested operators are invited to take part in the upcoming open market consultation (regardless of their geographic location , the size or governance structure of their organisation). The open market consultation will be organised in the form of a series of meetings. It will provide you with an overview of the procurement objectives, the PCP process and the main clauses of the contract. You will also have the opportunity to ask questions. The first series of meetings will be held online or hybrid by each of the procurers mentioned under Section I.1). During those meetings, the procurers .... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-12-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This service will be provided 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, as established by Law 2/2023, of March 13, on the Protection, Welfare and Ownership of pets and other animal welfare measures. This law establishes in Article 21.2 that "City councils may provide the collection and reception service by themselves or in association, under direct or indirect management.<br> In the case of indirect management of these services, the town councils must establish clauses on admission criteria, scoring and demand for execution linked to the objectives of this law."<br> Contracting of management services for the collection, maintenance and custody of animals from the municipal shelter and urban fauna in the municipality of Torrevieja.<br> The purpose of this contract is the provision of the s....
